channel.title: [Subm] Winter's End
channel.description:
Alright, so I don't have enough spare time to properly finish this before the contest ends, so putting up wheat I have already: 32bit Version: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1751617/gdcontest/WintersEndx32.rar 64bit Version: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1751617/gdcontest/WintersEndx64.rar If you can't figure out how to run it, you should be judging this contest. I've made it as easy as possible.
K, so Speljohan told me to enter this. May I introduce "Winter's End". Snowman protagonist, platformer game. Will update this post as I go. http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1751617/gdcontest/title.png [b]Update Day 1:[/b] Got title screen running and functional with random falling snow. Got basic GUI support for in-game, pause menu currently up and running. Created a quick and dirty ResourceManager to load all needed resources at startup. Got basic Entity/Player in place, Player currently renders an animated sprite, flipping depending on direction the player is facing. http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1751617/gdcontest/bgmap.png [b]Update Day 2:[/b] Got map loading and display done, along with backgrounds on per-map basis. Got initial player movement, and falling done. Collision checks on player completed. Initial death completed. http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1751617/gdcontest/particles.png [b]Update Day 3:[/b] Didn't work on it too much today. Got falling snow and lava spitting particles done for in-game. Fixed up player animations and added a proper moving animation different from the idle one. http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1751617/gdcontest/temphp.png [b]Update Day 4:[/b] Only a little bit worked on today. Implemented a basic health system. Reworked initial damage and death system to include temperature + health. Added falling damage + map areas that raise temperature. (Higher temp causes you to take damage) [b]Update Day 5:[/b] Minor tweaks to health/temperature system. Started working on trigger points. [b]Update Day 6:[/b] Nothing done today. http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1751617/gdcontest/dialogue.png [b]Update Day 7:[/b] Started recording a timelapse of the remaining development with chronolapse. Implemented dialogue. Started to implement enemies. Reworked how animations were handled for the player. http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1751617/gdcontest/newtiles.png [b]Update Day 8:[/b] Created image for Dialogue area. Created more images for the maps, fixed up current maps. Continued on enemies. - Implemented enemy movement and attacking. [b]Update Day 9:[/b] Added player attacking + projectiles. Tweaked various game-play features. Started working on more content. http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1751617/gdcontest/tilecomparison.png [b]Update Day 10:[/b] Started working on graphics. Reworked old maps to use new graphics. [b]Update Day 11:[/b] More graphics work. Zoomed in on game, more pixel-y. Started working on new maps. [b]Update Day 12:[/b] Nothing done today. http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1751617/gdcontest/hptemp.png [b]Update Day 13:[/b] More work on the maps. Started implementing *better* graphics.

More like silly windows with it’s case-insensitivity, everything else in the world is case-sensitive, get used to it.

That does fix it though, thanks.

Silly lunix case sensitivity.

Go ./data/imagelist.txt

change defaultFont.png to defaultfont.png

item.title: [Subm] Winter's End
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I wanted to play this now that you have won the contest, but I can’t seem to get it to work. I downloaded the LWGL libraries myself for my platform (64-bit Linux) and got it to run, almost:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.RuntimeException: Resource not found: /data/defaultFont.png
        at org.newdawn.slick.util.ResourceLoader.getResourceAsStream(ResourceLoader.java:69)
        at org.newdawn.slick.opengl.InternalTextureLoader.getTexture(InternalTextureLoader.java:169)
        at org.newdawn.slick.Image.<init>(Image.java:196)
        at org.newdawn.slick.Image.<init>(Image.java:170)
        at net.buddat.winterend.ResourceHandler.init(ResourceHandler.java:26)
        at net.buddat.winterend.WinterEnd.init(WinterEnd.java:45)
        at org.newdawn.slick.AppGameContainer.setup(AppGameContainer.java:390)
        at org.newdawn.slick.AppGameContainer.start(AppGameContainer.java:314)
        at net.buddat.winterend.WinterEnd.main(WinterEnd.java:90)

Maybe you meant ./data ?

Read full topic

item.title: [Subm] Winter's End
item.dc:creator: @Budda Budda
item.description:
@Budda wrote:

Alright, so I don’t have enough spare time to properly finish this before the contest ends, so putting up wheat I have already:

32bit Version: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1751617/gdcontest/WintersEndx32.rar
64bit Version: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1751617/gdcontest/WintersEndx64.rar

If you can’t figure out how to run it, you should be judging this contest. I’ve made it as easy as possible.

K, so Speljohan told me to enter this.

May I introduce “Winter’s End”.
Snowman protagonist, platformer game.

Will update this post as I go.

http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1751617/gdcontest/title.png

Update Day 1:
Got title screen running and functional with random falling snow.
Got basic GUI support for in-game, pause menu currently up and running.
Created a quick and dirty ResourceManager to load all needed resources at startup.
Got basic Entity/Player in place, Player currently renders an animated sprite, flipping depending on direction the player is facing.

http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1751617/gdcontest/bgmap.png

Update Day 2:
Got map loading and display done, along with backgrounds on per-map basis.
Got initial player movement, and falling done.
Collision checks on player completed.
Initial death completed.

http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1751617/gdcontest/particles.png

Update Day 3:
Didn’t work on it too much today.
Got falling snow and lava spitting particles done for in-game.
Fixed up player animations and added a proper moving animation different from the idle one.

http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1751617/gdcontest/temphp.png

Update Day 4:
Only a little bit worked on today.
Implemented a basic health system.
Reworked initial damage and death system to include temperature + health.
Added falling damage + map areas that raise temperature. (Higher temp causes you to take damage)

Update Day 5:
Minor tweaks to health/temperature system.
Started working on trigger points.

Update Day 6:
Nothing done today.

http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1751617/gdcontest/dialogue.png

Update Day 7:
Started recording a timelapse of the remaining development with chronolapse.
Implemented dialogue.
Started to implement enemies.
Reworked how animations were handled for the player.

http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1751617/gdcontest/newtiles.png

Update Day 8:
Created image for Dialogue area.
Created more images for the maps, fixed up current maps.
Continued on enemies.

  • Implemented enemy movement and attacking.

Update Day 9:
Added player attacking + projectiles.
Tweaked various game-play features.
Started working on more content.

http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1751617/gdcontest/tilecomparison.png

Update Day 10:
Started working on graphics.
Reworked old maps to use new graphics.

Update Day 11:
More graphics work.
Zoomed in on game, more pixel-y.
Started working on new maps.

Update Day 12:
Nothing done today.

http://dl.dropbox.com/u/1751617/gdcontest/hptemp.png

Update Day 13:
More work on the maps.
Started implementing better graphics.

Read full topic
